title: Bug 110566: Wrong data set result returned when setting an invalid filter expression with row[0]
description: When a filter like 'row[0] equals to 0' is set, the result set is either incorrect or null.
OB: When setting an invalid filter expression with row[0], the data set returns wrong results.
EB: The data set should either return the correct results or return a null result set when an invalid filter expression with row[0] is set.
SR:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Set a filter in the data set with the expression 'row[0] equals to '
2. Click on the Preview tab.

Actual result:
The first result record is returned incorrectly when previewing.

Expected result:
As the developer said, row[0] can only be generated after all the data has been fetched. Therefore, row[0] should not be used as a filter expression.
